column4: Hello. Big trouble here. A friend of mine has bought an asus eeepc 1225C, which contains an Intel GMA 3600. Can't have any resolution higher than 1024x768... I installed Xubuntu 12.04 32 bits. Launched jockey-gtk. Proposed me cedraview drivers for this card... But can't boot now.
i mean i can boot but i'm talking to you through weechat on a tty
Boot stuck with a message : "could not write bytes : broken pipe"
√çt's 3 o clock here and my friend absolutely needs her laptop for tomorrow morning... If anyone has any idea...
No one ?
have you tried uninstalling the drivers and using the default for now
or just do a fresh install as a last resort :(
muelli ... Purged the drivers. But can't boot...
what is the error message it is giving you?
no more message. "Checking battery state. [ok]" then nothing
are you using lightdm?
no... Just using xubuntu out of the box (gdm i think ?)
at the tty type sudo service gdm restart
unrecognized service
coming back (reboot)
any luck? if not go to tty          startx           what is the output?
now it crashes after "stopping system v compatibility [ok]"...
! Works
huh?
a bad resolution yet, but back to normal. Thanks.
startx worked?
